intro: Cryptolepis albicans, commonly known as white cryptolepis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest margins. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cryptolepis albicans is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for various ailments.
